creator: saket@openhere.com
text:
We have got an Apache web server.
The site is used for placing orders online. While testing we must have placed 
around more then 10000 orders we never faced this problem. The issue is  
sometimes when the customer try to enter the record two records are entered in 
the database. I am very sure that we are not calling the procedure twice. Even 
the logs stats that the procedure to enter the order is called twice.
Below given are the logs from the web server for the two records entered for 
the same order place. I will be great if you can explain the contents in the 
log.

[10/May/2004:17:20:05 +0100] 212.183.131.162 - - Mozilla/4.0 (compatible; MSIE 6
.0; Windows NT 5.1; .NET CLR 1.1.4322) "POST /pls/sart/S_POST_ORDER.LOAD HTTP/1
.1" 0
[10/May/2004:17:20:06 +0100] 212.183.131.162 SSLv3 RC4-MD5 Mozilla/4.0 (compatib
le; MSIE 6.0; Windows NT 5.1; .NET CLR 1.1.4322) "POST /pls/sart/S_POST_ORDER.L
OAD HTTP/1.1" 2708

creator: jorton@redhat.com
text:
This kind of thing happens if the user accidentally double-clicks a "Submit"
button in the browser; it's common to use JavaScript to disable the Submit
button after it activates to avoid the issue. This is unlikely to be an httpd bug.
